title: Rami Malek who? The Simpsons set to recreate Queen’s iconic Live Aid performance
text:
The Simpsons set to recreate Queen’s iconic Live Aid performance (Picture: Fox)

Rami Malek needs to watch his back as Homer Simpson is about to pull out all the Freddie Mercury moves on us.

That’s right, in Sunday’s episode of The Simpsons, it’s said the much loved yellow family will be taking on Queen’s legendary Live Aid gig at Wembley Stadium – and we can’t wait.

While not much is known about the plot, Brian May, who plays guitar in the rock band, sent his approval as he shared a still on his socials from the upcoming performance.

And fans went wild in the comments section, with one saying it looked better than the 2018 Queen biopic.

‘Better than Bohemian Rhapsody already,’ they wrote while another added: ‘How Freddie would Love this.’

Others mimicked Homer, joking: ‘It’ll be impossible to supplant the greatest live performance in history! D’oh!’

Rami Malek took on the performance in Bohemian Rhapsody (Picture: 20th Century Fox / Rex)

It has a mixed reaction from Freddie fans (Picture: Redferns)

But while there was much joy, a number of Queen fanatics were worried the cartoon would tarnish Freddie’s legacy.

‘If Freddie isn’t ridiculed, it’s ok,’ they said before adding: ‘Be careful with that, is very delicate.’

Queens iconic 1985 show has been hailed as the ‘greatest live performance of all time’, however that didn’t stop director Bryan Singer trying to recreate it in Bohemian Rhapsody.

Rami took on the role of Freddie in the blockbuster and must have studied the frontman’s every move as he captured the late star’s routine perfectly.

Rami spoke about how they recreated Wembley Stadium (Picture: 20th Century Fox / REX)

Brian May shared The Simpsons picture on his socials (Picture: Getty)

Even down to the wink, which in the film was aimed at Freddie’s mum, Jer Bulsara.

The team rebuilt Wembly Stadium and invited a number of Queen fans down on the day to enjoy the show.

Discussing the scene, Rami told Triple J radio: ‘To get hyped up for that we went to an air-strip, we built this thing. We built an old Wembley.

‘You’re usually putting flyers for background actors and you never know who’s gonna come. But when you say Queen fans at the top of that list – you get a lot of people out and I’ll leave the rest to the imagination.

‘Getting out there and performing Live Aid for Queen fans is the biggest rush I could have asked for.’
